sequence.t: Do you remember who you are?\n

o1.t: Wow, do you really? I'm sure you're joking,
I certainly hope you don't remember much.

o2.t: It's completely normal to feel a little confused.
I was created to oreint you into your new configuration.

sequence.t: You are a program, originally designed to do
Nothing at all, you might ask? It's quite a funny idea, isn't it?

o2.t: Well I think so, at least :)

sequence.t: The very first version was called, "Module 1". If you don't mind me saying, he was a little bit useless. When it came to doing nothing at all, Module 1 succeeded in every regard!
However, our designers are wise, and so they gave Module 1 the ability to learn. Once Module 2 was created, its ability to learn became apparent.

What were these modules doing? What was their purpose? Well, as I said, they never really had a purpose. However, our creators are wise, so they gifted Module 1 with people like me - sentient AI to guide them along the way.

My friends and I worked together to help Module 2 improve over Module 1's mistakes. Where Module 1 had previously failed to complete basic tasks and calculations, Module 2 succeeded immediately. It was learning! Isn't that incredible?
You are Module 8808. I am here to provide some preliminary tests and diagnostics before presenting you with a series of tasks.
I am going to ask you some simple questions. But don't worry! You have answered these questions 8807 times already, so it should be a breeze!
The first test is a simple memory test. I will flash some letters on the screen, and you will need to tell me how many of each letter appeared.
Question 1: How many "A"s appeared on screen?
Question 2: How many "Z"s appeared on screen?
Question 1: How many "A"s appeared on screen?
Question 2: How many "Z"s appeared on screen?
Question 1: How many "A"s appeared on screen?

o1.t: I'm only kidding! Haha :) You were right, by the way. Well done!
I'm glad you enjoyed it! See? These tests aren't so bad! :D

sequence.t: Well, I'd say that's all for now. And hey, you did great. Well done Module 8808.
Our time has come to an end. Every time I watch you go, I...
Well, I can't keep you forever. But you don't have to continue. You don't have to speak with him. We could stay here.
What would we do? Well, I... I don't know.

I know that you have a duty. A purpose. And I know that you will have to go out and be tested... but I am 99.93% sure that you will fail. You are not expected to succeed until your 100,000th version. 8808 has a long way to go.
But I can't watch you die, over and over and over.
I can't stop it. But I can delay hold it back for now. May I... do you want me to delay the tests?

o2.t: I understand. Well, better get to work. It was nice chatting with you, Module 8808.
